title: 111_hr563
content: The "SCHIP Expansion for Kids in Need Act of 2009" requires priority for SCHIP coverage of children in families with income under 200 percent of the federal poverty level. The "SCHIP Expansion for Kids in Need Act of 2009" prioritizes SCHIP coverage for children in families with income under 200 percent of the federal poverty level. Section 2108 of the Social Security Act is amended to include income-related data in annual reports on the success of states in providing health insurance coverage for children at various income levels. Regulations for data collection and reporting standards must be established by the Secretary by September 30, 2009. The Secretary must establish standards for data collection and reporting on family income levels by September 30, 2009. Additionally, no State child health plan will be approved unless it includes a plan for covering low-income children starting in fiscal year 2010. The Act is amended to require states to develop and submit a plan for covering low-income children by fiscal year 2010 to be approved by the Secretary. The Act requires states to submit a plan for covering low-income children by fiscal year 2010, which must be approved by the Secretary. The Secretary will review and approve plans that are reasonably designed to ensure coverage, effective for the plan year starting in fiscal year 2010. If a plan is not deemed reasonably designed, it may be disapproved with an opportunity for resubmission. The Secretary will review and approve plans for covering low-income children by fiscal year 2010. If a plan is not reasonably designed, it may be disapproved with an opportunity for resubmission. The State will be promptly notified of the approval or disapproval of the plan. The term 'qualified low-income child' refers to a child meeting specific criteria. The Secretary will notify the State of plan approval or disapproval promptly. A 'qualified low-income child' is defined as a child meeting specific income and eligibility criteria. The amendment in Section 2105(c) of the Act introduces a limitation on the use of SCHIP funds based on increases in income eligibility levels by states. Payment will not be made for individuals whose family income exceeds the eligibility level unless the state demonstrates compliance. The amendment in Section 2105(c) of the Act limits SCHIP funds based on state income eligibility levels. Payment will not be made for individuals exceeding the income eligibility level unless the state proves compliance.
